Department of Zoology

   The Department of  Zoology  was started in  1970. Renamed as the department of Advanced Zoology and Biotechnology in 2004, it is a reputed centre for the study of biological sciences. The department has produced 14 university rank holders since 2000, and  has a good track record in the field of research for the past 3 decades. It has operated 3 major projects and  published nearly 154 research papers in reputed national/international journals. Currently it runs 4 major research projects and 16 scholars are working in the department for their Ph.D. The department has produced a good number of Ph.D and M.Phil scholars. It has also conducted 7 seminars at national level.

   The area of specialisation includes immunology, environmental toxicology and chirepterology. The department has conducted several workshops to the teachers of colleges in their area of specialisation. As an extension activity the department offered Bee keeping course for unemployed women with the funding of UGC, Certifiate course in Vermi Technology and Medical Lab Technology in and around Alwarkurichi. The department is equipped with several sophisticated equipments for high level research.
